Что сказать, игра - воплощение хардкора.
Зашёл в игру, рандомно выбрал класс, нажал "start" и тут понеслась.
Эти чёртовы инопланетяне не оставляли мне шанса, чётко давая понять, что это их территория, и что они выебуи в жопу каждого, кто посягнётся на их святыню.
Спустя 2 часа я конечно вкурил об одной тактике, и на изи взял все длстижения, но осадок остался.
Kensai так вообще на столько сложный, что мой зад буквально горел (и нет, это не от того, что мои враги меня ебали. Или не совсем из-за этого.) и моя кожа покрылась волдырям, я стал чисто красного цвета, так что индейцы приняли меня за своего вождя и сожгли на костре во имя своего бога.

Плюсы :
+ Ураганный, захватывающий геймлей, который на некоторое время оторвёт вас лт реальности.
+ Оригинальное звукосопровождение.
+ Два режима игры, которые напрямую влияют на сложность.
+ Хардкорные "матчи" и сильные, разнообразные враги.
+ Коллекционные карточки, знаски, фоны для профиля.
+ Достижения. Куда же без них.
+ 4 класса с особыми способностями.
+ Цена.
+ ХАРДКОООООР!

Минусы :
- Ограничение по времени в каждой игре.
- Баги, с помощью которых легко победить.



На этом всё, иди играй!

40361646.review:
This is the first game to really make me fear widescreen.

It's a top-down skill/twitch/arena shooter where horizontal space is aplenty but scant vertical space just invites a hail of surprise lasers that'll be the death of you. So don't walk up or down if you don't have to. Moving feels kind of loose and basically encourages staying in one spot.

The bullet slicing concept is marvellous (basically countering attacks without it turning into a QTE) and should be evolved outside arena shooters. I'd love to see a game where it's the main thing and not just the defense using your startling reaction.

The aesthetic is flawless, and this game isn't nearly as difficult as you have reviewers proclaim. I guess it's been tweaked around, and the designer made like five of these games, each ostensibly just a retune, so I guess it's a really popular game. Anyway, it's fun for a bit but you'll outgrow the original's limitations and easy ways of getting a high score fairly fast, so I guess that's why all the sequels. Five games in all! Wow.

Oh yeah, looks like Steam underestimates the hours clocked again. Typical.

40345809.review:
Bom jogo.

O jogo consiste em sobreviver.
Com um nivel de dificuldade extremo e uma jogabilidade bem simples o jogo tem um desafio interessante.
Escolha sua arma. Seja atirando nos inimigos ou usando a espada rebatendo o fogo dos adversarios.
Arma 1 - Espada (rebate fogo inimigo)
Arma 2 - Bazuka 1 tiro
Arma 3 - Laser 2 tiros
Arma 4 - Laser 3 tiros
Arma 5 - Laser 4 tiros

Existe uma possibilidade de nascer com 2, 3, 4 ou 6 vidas.. 
Claro que a arma que ira pegar sera proporcional ao numero de vidas escolhido. Exemplo se escolher 6 vidas ira comecar somente com uma espada.

Pós
- Jogabilidade.
- Armas legais.
- Trilha Sonora adequada.

Contras
- Nao existe parede nas laterais tornando impossivel encostar nos cantos ou fugir de inimigos de fora do ''ring''.
- Dificuldade muito alta.
- Campo de visao muito limitado tornando impossivel ver os tiros adversarios chegando de alguns pontos.
- Espada muito lenta.

O jogo e bem interessante porem um nome adequado para o game? Impossivel fugir!
Nao tem para onde correr.. Nao existe bug que voce possa fazer para tentar ganhar algum tipo de vantagem ou proteçao. Tem que ganhar na raça.. Um desafio legal porem bem limitado. A versao 1 e 2 do jogo sao praticamente identicas e por esse motivo usarei a mesma analisa para ambos. Nao achei nada de diferente alem do MENU principal. As opçoes do game sao iguais. Caso alguem jogue porfavor me corrija caso esteja errado.

Recomendo somente em promoçao. Jogo e bom porem muito limitado e praticamente impossivel ganhar sem tentar 8948990345x...

Duvidas ou sugestoes? Postem aqui. :D

39561589.review: Без понятия откуда у игры положительные отзывы. UBERMOSH представляет из себя один мизерный ужасно выполненный уровень на котором вам предстоит отбиваться от бесконечных мобов, которые спамят выстрелами со всех щелей. Анимации выполнены ужасно, гг прорисован отвратительно. Враги прут тупо отовсюду, поэтому укрыться за преградами, которые есть на уровне, не получится. Что самое весёлое- вас часто будут дамажить именно тогда, когда вы даже не видите врагов, которые подступают к вам откуда-то из-за экрана, так как камера приближена слишком сильно. Самым большим разочарованием оказался хитбокс вашего персонажа- он, мать его, на добрую половину экрана. Именно из-за этой курьёзности вы будете умирать тогда, когда противник только-только выстрелил по вам, ведь урон защитывается мгновенно и отреагировать на это не представляется возможным для человека. Представьте, что между вами и врагом 100 метров, он выстреливает и снаряд пролетевший 15 метров из ста убивает вас. В итоге мы получаем симулятор смерти просто потому что. Музыка совершенно не понравилась, хотя обычно в таких проектах она- единственное, что доставляет. Брал игру за 15 рублей и это ПОТОЛОК для подобного проекта. Не рекомендую к покупке, даже для коллекции или карточек- сомнительное занятие.

39547010.review:
After a long time of looking at this game in my library, I decided to give it a try, and golly, this game is way worse than I thought it would be.

   So, you choose your class-mod in the upper left of the title screen, since the UI is terrible and you probably didn't know that was a feature until you looked at the achievements, and then you hit play.

   You load in, and the first 10 seconds of the 90 the "event" lasts is waiting for enemies to appear. Once they do, you have to either shoot them if you chose a class mod, or deflect their bullets with your sword to kill them and grab theirs. It sounds like a great idea, except the amount you can see is the equivalent of trying to dodge a pole looking at your own feet.

   The left and right sides are good; you get enough warning from their. However, an enemy above or below where you can see can take one step and fire, making you tank the damage unless you have a -4 second reaction time. My -3 second didn't cut it.

   The events then ramp up in difficulty by having 50 Quinquagintillion enemies swarming you, with no invulnerability time between hits, so you can have 4 seconds left on the event, then eat 4 bullets at once and lose.

   This game is cheap, because the gameplay is. I will continue to play it to get the achievements, then the last button I get to press is the uninstall one.

39329434.review:
Если покупать на 90% скидке, то сойдёт. А вот за полную цену тут покупать нечего! За что тут 200+ рублей отдавать? За один единственный уровень, одного персонажа, один меч и примерно 5 пушек? Тут нет кампании, нет сюжета: всё, что надо: продержаться 90 секунд и набить как можно больше очков. И снова... и снова... и снова... А знаете, как это может сделать любой? Объясняю тактику: выбиваешь пушку, которая стреляет красными шариками и, тупо стоя на месте, стреляешь во все стороны. Враги будут умирать ещё за экраном и ты без проблем продержишься 90 секунд. И вот продержался ты... снова продержался... снова... ничего не меняется, игра всё та же, уровень всё тот же... и что дальше? Знаете, сколько мне понадобилось времени, чтобы обнаружить и успешно применить эту тактику?  20 минут. А потом я сделал это ещё два раза. В сумме, я не наиграл в эту игру и часа, а уже прошёл её три раза. Есть ещё тут три режима, помимо основного: без пушек, но с мечом; без меча, но с пушками и ещё один я забыл. Самый интересный из них - основной. Видимо, дальше я должен долбить в эту игру, пытаясь побить свой рекорд по очкам, вот только сбить свой рекорд у вас не будет желания по следующей причине: в этой игре очень странно просчитывются попадания. То есть обычно всё под контролем, но часто бывает, что ты проде и отбил, условно, пули, но тебя всё равно покоцало. Наш ГГ тут явно шире, чем он нарисован, поэтому если противник подойдёт близко, ты даже его выстрел не увидишь, как уже сдохнешь и отправишься на нескипываемый экран смерти. 
Ну и последнее - музыка. Разрабы явно ею гордятся, раз продают её отдельно. Она действительно неплоха, но её штуки две-три на всю игру.
Короче говоря, если и хотите такой фигни, то купите на скидку и/или потом верните деньги. Благо "подниметесь" на карточках

¿Te gusta Nuclear Throne? Entonces tenés que jugar a su antecesor: U B E R M O S H.

Ubermosh es un juego divertido, MUY DIFÍCIL, pero divertido. Tiene pocos logros, pero 3 de los 7 logros, para mí, son muy difíciles. Eso depende del criterio de cada uno. Cada partida dura 80 segundos, pensarás que es poco, pero al jugar parece como si pasaran 30 minutos. Es un juego muy frenético (y su OST lo hace mucho más frenético de lo que es), quizás le falta variedad (Y UN MAPAAAA), pero al spawnear tantos bichos a la vez, no se nota la poca variedad. 
El balance de las armas no está bien, o sea, hay 4 armas:
1. Una sola bala pero más grande y gorda
2. 2 balas largas
3. 3 balas redondas
4. 6 balas largas
Sugongo que se dan cuenta de la diferencia, ¿No?

37553813.review:
The colony provides us everything except for violence.

The game’s tagline is a fitting one, since this title provides nothing but violence in wholesome abundance. To put in summary, Ubermosh is a fast pace, bullet hell game, in which you must survive for as long as possible and compete for a high score.

A typical session of play would last between 10 to 90 seconds, though more likely than not, you will experience a short life of less than 30. This is by no means bad, since you are pump and psyched to abort, retry and fail; over and over again. The mechanics is simple, as a rookie gladiator you must utilise your sword to slice bullets that are fired your way, that or dodge to avoid your demise.

Any creatures you kill in the Mosh Pit will drop their gun, with which there are 4 variants to pick from. While they might function in similar ways, the firing rate and spread pattern are different, so you must learn and adapt according to different situations. Turtling can be a good tactic, but you also unwittingly minimised your encounters with foes, thus limiting your end score. Run and Gun might work better score wise, but you run the chance of dying early. The game rewards you well in weighting the risks and taking the gambit accordingly.

Music was another aspect of the game done well, sporting a soundtrack over 30 minutes long, it accentuates the chaotic action to a new height. You will be motivated to survive longer, for each subsequent round, just so you can hear the track go further beyond. While I don’t normally buy game soundtracks on Steam, this is one of the rare occasions which I did, with no regrets.

The weakest department of this title, arguably, would be the story. Let’s be honest, the lore is practically nonexistent here, though for an arcade game, it didn’t need an extensive one. In another way, the lack thereof plays to the favour of this game by remaining vague. As each sequel in the series contain a tag line with which the plot advances slightly, while revealing little in the progress.

For conclusion, if you are new to the series and don’t mind spending a few dollars, I would say get it all in chronological order (or in a bundle). Though if you are really strapped for cash, just get the latest release of the series instead, since you aren’t missing much besides minor changes in mechanics and game modes.

36382251.review:
Я решительно не понимаю, откуда у этой игры столько отзывов вообще, такой большой процент положительных отзывов, да ещё и, судя по форуму, активное комьюнити. Ubermosh это обычная игра-арена, где мы бегаем по ограниченному пространству и перемалываем толпы бегущих на нас врагов.
 Единственная интересная фишка - есть возможность отбивать выстрелы врагов мечом в них самих. Это все. В игре ровно одна арена, два режима игры (отличаются только количеством врагов), один интересный персонаж из четырех доступных, одно действительно полезное оружие (остальное нужно, чтобы продержаться до его получения), минимум разнообразия в тактике. 
Это не все - в игре нет даже нормальной статистики и таблицы лидеров. Все, что видит игрок - это максимум очков, который он когда-либо набирал. Вот как можно сделать игру-арену, где нет сюжета, а игровая сессия длится максимум полторы минуты, и не добавить в игру нормальную статистику...
Справедливости ради, игра очень динамичная и драйвовая, но тут заслуга разработчика скорее в том, что он не испортил совсем уж до конца идею подобных игр, которые динамичные и драйвовые по умолчанию. И да, игра стоит копейки. Приобрести её и погонять пару часиков конечно можно, но она явно перехвалена и ничего особенного из себя не представляет.

34672251.review:
UBERMOSH is a hardcore cyberpunk bullet-hell game in which you can cut, shoot and deflect to try and survive for as long as possible.

Pros:
-Gameplay is fast and solid, which is greatly needed in a bullet-hell. Movement is responsive and fast.
-Visually stunning with it's pixel-cyberpunk feel to it, giving slight feelings of an 80's sci-fi to it
-Music and sound effects are amazing
-It has trading cards and Steam Achievements
-It is brutally unforgiving, as a bullet-hell should be
-Different classes, each which take a different playstyle to master

Cons:
-None

Overall, this is one of the, if not the best bullet-hell games I've played in a long time and at R12 (~$1) it's definitely worth a look.
10/10

34270631.review:
UBERMOSH is a great little top-down shooter game. Your only goal is to survive for 90 seconds while also trying to beat your high score, which is measured in kills.

Pros
- Fun and fast gameplay
- Good visuals 
- A great soundtrack that gets you pumped while you play
- Four different classes that mix up the gameplay a little bit, as well as being suited for different playstyles
- The price

Cons
- No options menu to adjust graphics or sound settings, but the volume can be easily adjusted via Volume Mixer (For Windows users)
- The player automatically picks up whatever gun they walk over which can be annoying, however once you get the best gun in the game it stops happening

I would recommend this game to pretty much anyone, especially because of the low price. Fans of other top-down shooter titles like Hotline Miami and Nuclear Throne will definitely like this game.

34258648.review:
UBERMOSH to bardzo przyjemna gra o szybkiej rozgrywce i świetnym soundtracku. W tym tytule jesteśmy wrzucani do Cyberpunkowego Bullethell, a naszym zadaniem jest posłanie do piachu jak największej ilości wrogów, którymi zalewana jest niewielka mapa. Śmierć i zniszczenie możemy siać przy pomocy miecza, który za równo sprawdza się przy klasycznej walce w zwarciu, jak i odbijaniu pocisków wroga w stylu Rycerzy zakonu Jedi, czy kilkoma rodzajami blasterów o różnej charakterystyce wystrzelonych promieni.
Gra ma wysoko ustawioną poprzeczkę jeśli chodzi o poziom trudności, chwila nieuwagi i możemy pożegnać się z jednym kwadracikiem symbolizującym jedno "życie", mimo tego walka przynosi ogromną satysfakcję i frajdę.
Oprawa graficzna, również ma swój urok, grafika w stylu retro bardzo dobrze wprowadza w klimat Cyberpunk, razem z wcześniej już wspomnianym doskonałym soundtrackiem.
Według mnie gra warta swojej ceny, ze względu na tonę radości jaką może dostarczyć.
Polecam

33506345.review:
Puah, would I recommend this game ? Probably, but in the end it was the missing finetuning that threw me off. Don't get me wrong the fast gameplay is fun, but if you want to feel like you failed because you weren't good and not because it was random, then this game can be quite frustrating at times.
I'm getting straight to the point, these are the problems I had while playing:


-Low Fov
  The camera is awfully close to your playermodel, it is
  so close that it is a risky move to go up and down the
  map because you might randomly run into an enemy
  that will immediately shoot you.

-Enemy Ai
  Enemies move pretty random over the map, so far so
  good, but they shoot you at an almost fixed distance
  and that distance is so close to you that deflecting
  bullets is more guessing than reacting, wouldn't be 
  too big of a problem if most classes didn't start 
  without a gun, and one class that entirely focuses on
  the blade.

-Hitbox
  I have honestly no idea how big the hitbox of the 
  playermodel is but I'm pretty sure it's too big, some 
  bullets hit where there should be atleast 1 or 2 pixels
  (ingame pixel not screen pixel) space left.

-Invisible bullets
  Bullets are sometimes pretty big, they spawn a 
  small distance in front of the enemy and they 
  disappear when they hit you, if you are close enough
  to an enemy and there isn't enough space they don't
  spawn at all, or better you just can't see them so you
  get killed by literally nothing.

-Movement not precise
  keyboard or controller, the minimum-distance you 
  move is about 2 playermodel-sizes which lacks, in my
  opinion precision.

-No options menu
  There is just none, if i wouldn't be able to adjust the 
  dpi of my mouse this game would have been 
  unplayable.

All these points combined gave me lots of "What killed me?", 
"... Wat?" and "I was shot with nothing... yay" -moments.
Which aren't really good moments for a videogame , but if you still want to play this or atleast try it out, wait for a sale 50 cent is okay I guess.

Edit:
Seriously... just skip straight to Ubermosh Vol. 5
-Black adds a 360 attack after a specific amount of kills.
-Vol. 3 adds wider Fov(which is nice), and takes away the rocks 
-Wraith adds a timed area attack.
-Vol. 5 has all of that.
...but still no options-menu.

33434441.review:
全成就达成来写篇测评。
首先，我是很久之前就买了这个游戏，大概是只有出了这一部的游戏就买了，当时也只是看到两块钱当成喜加一系列就随手买了。
个人以为，这个游戏最好的是音乐，很燃非常不错也很符合这个游戏。就算是说花钱买这个soundtrack送游戏对我来说也是可以接受。其次，很快的游戏节奏像那些小时候的街机一样，你会很快就融入音乐之中，这种一击必死的设定很轻易就get到了那种燃点，欲罢不能。切子弹这个设定也是一种不错的中二游戏方式，为这个游戏增添不少趣味，甚至说是最主要的东西，没有之一。
瑕疵的话，可能是制作经验不够？？在我看来真的不少。首先就明显的就是屏幕的震动，我承认正是这个设定让人容易着迷的关键。但没免真的有点过大。一旦被敌人围住基本就被这样交代了，令人非常闹心。
四种模式的特征真的不明显，而且放左上角令我觉得看起来很炫但没有一点提示所以我是真的很久之后才发现是可以换模式的。
除了那个切子弹的模式，其他两个比较无聊像是应付任务的一样。另外我不知道为什么总是在我玩着一个模式之后，就突然给我换一个，就这样换了一下连一点点提示都不给我，莫名其妙。
另外对于宽屏的显示屏就自动开启困难模式，上下会有黑边，鼠标在上下两边的藏在了那些黑边之中，根本操作不了。
但不管怎么样，能做到这样也值得令人称赞，对于这种类街机游戏，或许不该想那么多，也许只该直接地无脑开始，尽情消灭便是最好的了。

33413983.review:
Динамичная экшн аркада с видом сверху. Сюжета как такого нет. 
Главная героиня шинкует насекомообразных существ энергетическим клинком и может отбивать их выстрелы в лучших джедайских традициях. 
Все супостаты атакуют исключительно с дистанции, и не идут в рукопашную. 
Также можно расстреливать врагов из разных пушек. Оружие можно забирать прямо с убитых жертв, патроны бесконечны.

+ Игра проста в освоении
+ Есть карточки
+ Пиксельная графика, простая концепция, кислотно-неоновые цвета - UBERMOSH будто выбралась прямиком из эпохи игровых автоматов.
+ Качественный брутальный саундтрек, под стать киберпанк атмосфере.
+ Относительно легко получить все достижения.

- Одна и та же карта.
- Проходится слишком быстро. После получения максимального ранга и всех достижений интерес пропадает.

33312043.review:
Рука уже разить устала, молочная кислота переполнила мышцы правой кисти…

Пример того, что игру можно сделать буквально на пустом месте. Картинка тут представлена в самом ужасном смысле пиксельного искусства. Протагонист  оказывается девушкой с мечом и пулемётом, развлекающейся массовыми убийствами на ограниченном прямоугольной границей площадке со случайно сгенерёнными укрытиями/препятствиями. Здесь также есть довольно бодрый саундтрек, правда он один.

Движение идёт с помощью WSDA клавиш, стрельба и удар мечом повешены на основные кнопки мыши. Основная цель — выжить 90 секунд, побочная — убить как можно больше многочисленных, но не шибко разнообразных гадов. [i]Всё.[/i] В смысле здесь [i]ничего[/i] больше нет, ну кроме того, что выжить довольно сложно и меч тут реально помогает, так как это единственный, кроме уклонения, способ защититься от летящей в вас толпы энергетических зарядов путём их отражения. 

Игра не сильно дорогая и любителям быстрой непритязательной адреналиновой встряски вполне себе показана. Для меня всё это излишне быстровато. Я добыл достижение «7 выживаний», но [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=683729717]не совсем честным способом[/url]. 

Автор пошёл спорным путём выпуска модификаций своей игры. Для каждой модификации он выпускает отдельную независимую игру, правда требует за них не более доллара (если нет скидки, естественно). Есть даже некоторая [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=885312840]мифология[/url] серии. В отличие от изначальной игры остальные не имеют ограничений и препятствий на площадке. Только героиня и толпы монстров. Кроме стандартного оружия появились волны (ну или что-то вроде) убийственных зарядов по выполнению определённых условий (50 убийств, например). Это значительно увеличивает количество трупов и набрать тысячу мертвяков в последней серии [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/640380/UBERMOSH_Vol5/]UBERMOSH Vol.5[/url] за 90 секунд вполне себе реально, как и заработать туннельный синдром ибо кликать нужно оооочень быстро.

Игра запускалась на ноутбуке  HP EliteBook 840 G1 со встроенной графической картой Intel® HD Graphics 4400 и Ubuntu 16.04 на борту. Сам игровой процесс шёл без нареканий, но при большом числе пятен крови на  экране  (счёт за сотни) игра начинает подтормаживать, что в каком-то смысле даже помогает ибо увеличивает время для реакции на раздражители, но уменьшает число убитых, так как счётчик секунд не замедляется.  При специальной проверке «можно ли переключиться по Alt+TAB и вернуться» игра повисла и её пришлось убить из консоли. С другой стороны переключаться тут особого смысла не имеет, так как сеанс длится не более полутора минут.

Пакет Убермошей был мной получен в подарок от [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/mr_myp]Мур[/url] для обзора. Я поблагодарил, сказал, что возможно когда-нибудь действительно посмотрю, но решил глянуть одним глазком и залип…

[h1]Этот обзор входит в список [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103944566]Игры, Linux, Steam, обзоры[/url].[/h1]

首先想练反应我可以告诉你不太实际，你真觉得你可以在那几毫秒内看到敌人远近所带来的威胁程度和判断四面八方的袭来的子弹先砍哪个再砍哪个么。
其次是我玩了半个多钟后对游戏的感受（NO GUN两滴血模式一开始没了一滴血后70多秒一点血没扣，然后，就没有然后了）
1.枪并不好用（个人感受，主要是来回切换脑子反应不过来，所以只用刀反而更持♂久）
2.刀的攻击距离超乎你想象
3.预判（别等敌人开枪后再去砍，还没开枪的时候就砍，具体时间把握难以描述，玩多jiba了会有个尺度的）
4.千万不要跟个愣头青那样冲过去砍别人
5.到处走动，别楞着（但也不要往人堆里冲）
6.如果给围了往人多那一边你可以试着瞎几把挥刀，有惊喜
7.最重要的一点，运气，没运气以上6点当我没说过就行了（最后几秒你跑向的边界刷出一群奇怪的东西来似乎并没有什么办法可以救得了我，我很绝望）

32708600.review:
[h1] ハイスピードアクション [/h1]

迫りくる敵から９０秒間生き残れ、敵を倒して銃を奪い、剣で銃弾を弾き返せ

[h1] ゲーム内容 [/h1]

基本は上に書いた事だけですが、モード(職業)があり、それぞれ特徴やHPなども違います、剣士はHPが高いが剣しか使えない、ガンナーはHPが若干低いのと剣が使えないが銃が連射になる、ウォーロックはHPが凄く少ないが最初から最強の銃を所持していて剣も使える、後ノーマルなキャラもいます。

展開が凄い早い９０秒生き残るだけのゲームだからか凄い勢いで敵が襲ってくるので何とか倒したり逃げたりして生き残る、それだけのゲームなのだが良くできている。

[h1] 個人的に思った事や感想 [/h1]

ゲーム的には面白いのだがハイスピード系というか展開が速いのは目がしょぼしょぼするんでおっさんにはきついです。

Un juego espectacular el cual casi siempre lo encontraras a un bajo precio, me compre la coleccion y todos me han gustado, ademas, he ido recibiendo los demas juegos que ha hecho este hombre de forma gratuita por unos  600 pesos chilenos (si no me falla la memoria).
Es frenetico, es entretenido, tiene una banda sonora expectacular, los controles responden al instante.
Vas morir tanto como lo que llegas a matar y aun asi no te aburres, tiene una difiicultad elevada (segun yo que no tengo manos) pero jamas injusta, si mueres sientes que es por tu culpa y no por que el juego asi lo quiso.
La pantalla normalmente se llena de enemigos y de balas pero esto no hace que te pierdas entre toda la balacera, lo cual creo que es por su fondo oscuro y todo lo que sea enemigos es con atractivos colores neones.
Tiene unas mecanicas bastante interesantes en especial cortar las balas y devolverlas, es un placer matar haciendo eso.
En otras palabras... Divertido, dificil, atractivo visualmente, cortas balas, cortas monstruos ( o lo que sean :3). Un juego maravilloso.

31110541.review:
Overall Score: 4/10 For Achievement Hunters Only 
Reviewed April 12th 2017

Pro:

The music is great to listen to, but distracts the laser like focus one is required to harness if they wish to stand a chance accomplishing the goals set in the game.

Getting 100% achievement for the game takes around 2-3 hours pending how lucky you are and how quickly you understand how spawn placement works.

Cons:

The gameplay design decisions are ultimately the reason I'm downvoting the game. Enemy projectiles will randomly phase through walls while none of the guns you can pick up will phase through walls. Enemies will teleport onto the battlefield within a short distance outside of the screen, making location awareness and shooting off screen the measurement of life and death. The display is presented in widescreen and due to how fast the enemy is in the game, makes vertical assaults the only real threat. 

Finally, the most annoying aspects are having the guns swapped without your consent until the Ultra Shotgun is acquired and the screen shaking during every attack. This isn't a game where all 3 rotating guns are balanced. All enemies require one bullet, making area of effect the most important tool in your arsenal.

In Closing:
It's a very basic arena shooter/slasher I've seen many times for flash games. Pick up guns, fire them with one button and deflect bullets with the default melee weapon. The artificial difficulty makes the game too annoying for a legitmate, enjoyable game experience. I see people only playing it past the first two playthrough for Steam Achievements and nothing more.

31099314.review:
Разработчики продают одну и ту же игру, меняя только арт в меню и добавляя новый класс (различие в классах всего лишь в количестве жизней и прочих незначительных аспектах.)  Таки 10 шекелей из 10.
Ну и что касается игры:
(-) Игра на 5 минут. Быстро надоедает, но в то же время для получения ачивок нужно потратить много времени, в итоге если хочешь ачивку - придется превозмогать.
(-) Неудобное управление. Геймпад мастхев, на клавамыши очень неудобно. 
(-) Урон по персонажу проходит раньше, чем снаряды визуально достигают хитбокса. Не знаю с чем это связано, возможно задержка монитора 6 мс.
(-) Очень бесит розовая дрисня, которая каждый раунд появляется в одно и тоже время. Непонятно что это вообще и зачем оно нужно. Настолько бесит, что отдельный минус.
Из плюсов только саунд. Годным назвать не могу, но для 15 рублей очень неплохо. Своей полной цены в 50 рублей эта поделка явно не стоит, не говоря уже о комплекте всех игр этой серии.

Ну, что ж, пора делать обзор на эту игру. И так- начнем:
 Стоит начать с того, что вы ожидаете получить за 1.5 бакса (по скидке- и того меньше), Я взял её по ошибке, но мысль о возврате средств отпала после 10ти минут игры, и вот почему:
 Это инди-экшен-слешер с восхитительным и драйвовым саундтреком, отлично вписывающимя в атмосферу происходящего хаоса: бодренькое рубилово, с ярким и спецефическим графическим оформлением, и небольшой продолжительностью, собственно, самой игры .
 Кажись, пришло время подводить итоги: как по мне, инра целиком окупает свою стоимость (по цене литра молока), после игры у меня осталось приятное впечатление.

30648087.review:
This game has potential but has 2 major flaws.

Firstly, the gameplay lacks substance. 6 minutes in and I just achieved SSS rank. That doesn't seem right...

Secondly, the view is much too small. Your player is also closer to the bottom of the view due to the perspective you play from. That means when moving down there's not enough time to react.

I don't think it's worth getting. I paid 0.50 for it, and I still feel robbed. I'm not going to knock on Valve's door to refund it since it hardly costs anything, but I really hope the developer reads this and addresses these issues.

30641507.review:
[h1]Кратко об игре:[/h1]
[b]Зубодробительная и стремительная нон-стоп экшн-аркада в киберпанк/сай-фай сеттинге. Первая игра в серии Ultakaar Chronicles от разработчика Walter Machado.[/b]

[h1]Что тут у нас есть?[/h1]
 [b]Геймплей[/b]
Как уже говорилось, зубодробительный и стремительный нон-стоп геймплей. Сражение на ограниченном боевом поле с ордой [Роем] яростных чудовищ с непрекращающимся уворачиванием, отбиванием вражеских пуль и пальбой - экшеном, короче говоря. Напоминает: [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/219150/]Hotline Miami[/url], [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/262830]Crimsonland[/url], [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/242680/]Nuclear Throne[/url], [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/33100/]Alien Shooter[/url] и т.п.
[quote=Doom] «Они сама ярость: жестокие, бесстрашные, неудержимые, беспощадные… Но ТЫ… Ты будешь еще хуже. Рви их в клочья, пока не уничтожишь всех!» [/quote]
[b]Киберпанк[/b]
Киберпанковым сеттингом здесь может и не сильно попахивает, но суровым, диким и неистовым далеким фантастическим будущем здесь просто благоухает! Смотрите, в общем, трейлеры. 
[b]Красивая графика и арт-работы[/b]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=880655971
[b]Улётнейший саундтрек[/b]
«Одна только музыка стоит того, чтобы играть в эти игры. Это постапокалиптичный сёрф-метал, отличный кумбийский-метал и треш-кибер-метал,» - сказал [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198048306670]MechaTails[/url]. 
Музыка задает всё настроение игре. Геймплей и саундтрек здесь подобны телу и душе – неразделимы (хотя саундтрек вполне отделим). [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/366420/]Рекомендую![/url]
[b]Сюжет[/b]
Да, он здесь есть. Как и смысл, которым игру обделяет подавляющее большинство обзорщиков. Автор подает сюжет постепенно через несколько предложений в началах игр/трейлерах, так что уловить его реально трудно. Но я все внимательно просмотрел и сложил общую картину мира UBERMOSH. Рекомендую ознакомиться с [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=885312840]руководством[/url].

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
[b]Идеальная игра в том плане, что она такая, какая должна быть: разработчик полностью удовлетворен ей, как и большинство играющих в эту малюсенькую аркаду (по меркам современных игр). Так что, если вы любитель исключительно изобилующих контентом игр – вам это чудо навряд ли понравится, разве что немного развлечет своим потрясным смузи из каждого её составляющего. 
[u]К покупке рекомендую как игру (эту и все последующие части), так и саундтрек.[/u] Насчет следующих частей поясняю: они не сильно отличаются друг от друга и представляют собой что-то типа частей комикса в серии комиксов или сезонов в ТВ-шоу.[/b]

30565641.review:
简单粗暴，手感不错。

WASD上下左右移动，左键打枪，右键挥刀（刀可以反弹子弹）
主页面左上角是切换模式，默认为无特殊设定，即出来时只有一把刀，可以捡枪
其他模式还有只能用枪和只能用刀的模式
主页面左边是成就完成条件，分别是特定模式取得多少分，取得200分7次（杀死一个怪物得一分），总体而言并不难
枪的话，根据颜色有不同的子弹，白色的两发散弹，黄色三发，紫色一个硕大的子弹= = 
最好用的是红枪，五发散弹
游戏流程很简单，坚持90秒存活即可
左上角头像旁边的倒三角是表示你的血量，中一发子弹扣一个，扣完就游戏结束
所有怪物都是一枪死

手残党可以找一个上下都有掩体的地方，注意左右边来怪就行了，上下时不时看一下就行

一些建议：
1.可以出一些boss关卡，增加一点难度
2.子弹数量设置一个限制，打完就只能跑位去捡
3.BGM给个设置开关或者调整音量都可以

总而言之是一款适合无聊的时候打发时间的小游戏
6/10   给一个及格分数

Неплохая аркада - стрелялка с видом сверху.
Графон в стиле ретро и динамичная музыка.

По сути смысла в игре никакого нет.  В ней нет ни сюжета, ни конца.
Играя за кибер ниндзю нужно уничтожить как можно больше врагов за отведённое время.

В общем игра довольно бодрая. На получение всех достижений уйдёт примерно полтора часа, но с реакцией как у ленивца из зверополиса, может даже и полтора года XD.

30089449.review:
I think this game is great, but at the same time theres a pacing problem. The difficulty curve is breakneck and the gameplay is great in itself. The main problem is the disconnect when you die is pretty obnoxious. When you die, which will happen a lot, you have to wait around 1.5 seconds for it to say you're 'being extracted' and then you're at the start screen, then you can hit play again then you wait another 5 seconds for stuff to start showing up on screen. The problem is that 6.5 seconds is seriously jarring for me personally because it's like you're ready for the bullet hell and you died instantly but now you have to wait another 6.5 seconds for the game to wind up to a speed that feels instense and fun.

Hotline miami did it well at times. Here's it's sort of like that but a time survival thing. The big difference here is that hotline miami  never took away your control of the pacing. Which would often time leads to massive frustration that you died for the 20th time  on a level and you just throw yourself at it and do everything as fast as possible with the most and sometimes you could smash out a part on just sheer frustration because the second you died you were back in the fight again. That 6.5 seconds is seriously jarring here. One second im cutting waves of bullets and sending them back the sheering sound effect is really great, and then suddenly it says being extracted since i died to a massive light show that...snuck up on me. and im like FUCK and then in the next 6.5 seconds my adrenaline high is gone because it has to crawl up to speed again. It's a fun game and really if it's on sale it's completely worth it. Even might be if it's not on sale. But the fact that it takes so long to move from attempt to attempt really kills the adrenaline fast pacing that this type of game has going for it.

29921208.review:
Es un juego simple, muy llano, pese a ello pide mucha intensidad y concentración. Es para aquellos que busquen un pequeño reto de dificultad. ¡Es muy dependiente de los reflejos!

En sí no encontramos mucha variedad, los tipos de enemigos se cuentan con una mano, pero no te hace falta más. Tu objetivo es conseguir matar el máximo de ellos esquivando en un bullet hell cenital. Para ello dispondremos de una espada y un arma de fuego. Mientras que una nos protejera cortando y también devolviendo proyectiles, el arma se encargará de limpiar el mapa de enemigos.

El juego carece de historia y demás, es un solo mapa, el cual varía cada vez en muros a modo de arena y nos da 90 segundos para sobrevivir tratando de matar el mayor número de enemigos.

Para hacer el juego entretenido y darle una meta, el propio creador nos ha dado una serie de logros los cuales serían el go-to de este shooter poniendo a prueba nuestra habilidad. No es para nada sencillo, y para el precio que tiene se compensa fácilmente.

Recomendado para gente que busque un reto.

29800806.review:
Okay, so, [i]UBERMOSH[/i]... I thought it was some random 8-bit crap that I probably won't like. But, I bought it anyway, since it sounded good. 

After installing it, I enter the main menu and feel weirded out by this weird-looking green-haired woman on the screen, but anyway, I go through the tutorial. And so far, it felt easy enough.

I start the game, and I play for like a few minutes. And then, I felt it was a nice buy, and then I quit the game and don't go back to it until I did recently.

20 minutes in, I realise how much this game can tick a person off. I had some negative thoughts about it. Like, why did I even buy an 8-bit crapola like this? Why does my respawn chance go down by one within less than 10 seconds? Why are the bullets firing toward me before I could even see it? Why is the area not big enough? What the fuck is so good about this fucking piece of shit game? 

5 more minutes in, I rage quit. 

Right after that, I calmed down. And then I realise that the game was meant to do just that. To test your skills. [b][u]Git gud or git rekt.[/u][/b] 

What I'm telling you is there's no graphical awesomeness with this game, there's no storyline, there's no concrete objective. You simply survive until your time runs out, which is 90 seconds. That sounds easy, right? Well, it's not. I rage quit, and thought about writing a negative review, just to spite it. And even after all that, this game is really entertaining. It's like one of those games with which you could develop a love-hate relationship. It's also a game which you either get addicted to for a long time, or you come back to occasionally.

The soundtrack is a huge plus. I love it, even though most of the tunes are very similar, so it [b]can[/b] be a bore for some, but that's only if you're the kind whose excitement for things dies off really fast. I, for one, think the soundtrack is what keeps my sanity in control as I slash through my pixelated enemies, because I die in like 30 seconds. Which is infuriating. 

Is it worth the buy? Definitely! Is it worth the buy in its full price? That's upto you, but I bought it during sale, and you ought to buy the full collection. Is it worth the buy during sale? Hell yeah, don't miss it out! And if not for the gameplay, atleast for the music (if you're a metal/rock fan, haters look elsewhere).

There's not much difference between this game and its follow-ups, except for maybe some changes or additions made to the soundtracks, and they're comparatively easier than this one, especially [i]UBERMOSH: BLACK[/i]. Other than that, it's pretty much the same. So, this review applies to all of them.

29795070.review:
Okay. My first impression of this game was "That's it?" "Is it possible to last more than 30 seconds?" 

I spent like 5 minutes and didn't opened the game for several months. 


Now, after distancing myself a bit from the first time... This game isn't half bad! It's actually great! Sure, it's simple, hard, the content feels a bit minimal, but... It's really satisfying. Slashing, shooting hordes of enemies while avoiding bullets... It's a real blast. It's not the kind of game you'll play for a long session, but it's definitely the kind where you'll go back and see if you can survive and beat your best score.

It's hard as nail at first, but once you get the grip on how to play, it's actually quite easy.

I bought this game and the soundtrack for .49 cents last night in a drunken game hunt. I wasn't sure what to expect, so I passed out and played it an hour ago.

If you've ever wanted to play a cyberpunk bullet-hell where you can deflect enemies bullets, where you can also shoot bullets - this game is perfect in all categories.

29160221.review:
Now usually I'm a very opened minded sort of guy that doesn't shy away from most games. There are two kinds of games I like, ones with a meaningful narrative that also works into the game play, that's "Oneshot", and one with fast paced kick ass game play, that's "F.E.A.R". Now sometimes those can mix together and make a deformed hybrid of a child that has tourettes [spoiler](makes you swear randomly)[/spoiler] that's your postal 2, which I personally think is one of my favorite games. Too bad that the country I lived in completely forgot the time that they were trying to be important like America [spoiler](its banned if you haven't figured it out)[/spoiler]. 

Now "UBERMOSH" falls into the latter category and I'm happy to say that what it says in the trailer is what it is. It's a fast paced hack and shoot game that is based around your reflexes and judgment skills, and you have to survive waves upon waves of morons for a certain time. 

[u]Gameplay[/u] 
The gameplay is based around your usage of the sword and gun. your sword can cut enemies and deflect bullets back at them, and a gun does what you think it does. There is very little variety in what gun does what and fall into a line graph of the worst to the best. Now you only have 90 seconds to survive which may not sound much, but it does feel like an eternity. Enemies are relentless and will constantly make you twitch around the screen to check your every angle, making it pretty enjoyable for anyone who wants a challenge in less than 5 minutes. 
 
Then you got your classes, you got your classless that starts with a sword, and can grab a gun. Your Kensai that has more health but can't pick up guns. Your gunner that has automatic fire with guns but can't use the sword and has less health and your warlock that starts with the best gun but with the least amount of health. Now obvious problem start to rise like, why would you need a gunner when she fires as fast as when you mash the mouse and why do I need a warlock when I can easily pick up the best gun in seconds. You are most likely to pick classless as your only class because of the variety of options you have and with a decent amount of health. There's probably no reason to pick the other classes unless you want the achievements. 

[u]Artificial intelligence[/u] 
The ai in this game is your standard brain dead, go in with numbers sort of guys. They will come in waves in an attempt to kill the player and even then over a hundred of them are already dead. What they make up for is their twitch movements they try to mimic the player making them unpredictable and some of them have a faster or slower attack speed. They all have one health and only carry guns, so it's nothing to talk a lot about, all you need to know that there are hundreds of them to kill. 

[u]Conclusion[/u] 
There's not really a lot to talk about, I usually talk about atmosphere as well and as interesting as it looks it not necessary. The game has very little content but what it makes up for is it's arcade like action. It's a really cheap game that will take you at least close to two hours to get all the achievements and is not for everyone. If you like fast gameplay like the old "Quake" and "DOOM" games get it if you want to. Your not really missing anything out but if you think it looks good buy it, probably get it on sale. If nothing interests you and you want story narrative games go look at "Lisa", "Undertale" or "Oneshot". I even made a review on "Oneshot" so if you want to know what the game is like, go check out the review.

best played while intoxicated with the subwoofer on max. bring wet-naps.

29158441.review:
[h1]OVERVIEW[/h1]
UBERMOSH (all caps) is a style-over-substance twin-stick shooter with a difference: your best weapon is your sword, which can reflect enemy shots.

The story behind UBERMOSH is limited, but there seems to be a degree of 'lore' surrounding the game and other similar ones by the one-man development team, Walter Machado. I won't try to delve into it other than to say that you play an armoured-up woman with a very big glowing sword and in each short (90-second) game you have to try to survive against hordes of gun-toting enemies.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
Graphics have a retro, pixel-graphic appeal to them. They're okay, but not the best pixel graphics I've seen. Animations are okay, too.

The level graphics are fairly bland and uninspired, but I think it is supposed to be a desert, so I guess that fits. In any case, the background gets splattered with gore fairly quickly.

There are no graphics options -- not even a full screen / windowed toggle -- but I found that ALT-ENTER does work for entering windowed mode, in Windows 10 at least, and from there you can resize the window if you want to.

[h1]Sound[/h1]
The music is really not my thing. A lot of people love it, but I really didn't. Sound effects are okay, and even somewhat useful in helping you get into 'the zone' given the difficulty of the game, but since there are no volume settings, and I don't want to listen to that music anymore, I've had to mute the sound effects while playing as well.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
UBERMOSH is a simple twin-stick shooter played in 90 seconds, if you can survive that long. You're dumped in the middle of a procedurally generated level with nothing but your armour and sword, and very shortly after that the game throws hordes of bad guys, aliens, and who knows what else at you.

Killing an enemy leaves a lovely pool of red slop behind, as well as the enemy's weapon, which you can pick up. There are a few different weapon types, with the best undeniably being a gun that fires five red shots in an arc, covering a fairly good portion of the field in front of you. Unfortunately there's no way to lock a weapon once you've picked it up, and with the battlefield quickly becoming littered with blood, gore, and enemy weapons that you'll unintentionally pick up when you run over them, you won't always be able to hold on to your red death for very long.

And that's basically it. There are a few different modes ('character mods') that provide you with different starting weapons and health ('respawns'), and Steam achievements to aim for if just trying to survive for 90 seconds or beating your previous score isn't enough for you. But there's no advancement or reward for playing other than a sense of satisfaction and relief. There doesn't seem to be any online score keeping or anything like that, either, so some fans have started a 'best score' thread with screenshots in the Steam discussions for the game, in case you want to brag.

There's no zooming in or out and the camera moves with you, keeping you in the centre of the screen. Given the aspect ratio, this means that you have less sight range between your character and the top and bottom of the screen than you do at the sides, so enemies coming from the top or the bottom regularly get the jump on you; you'll often find a run ended by an enemy spewing the five red beams of death at you from one of those directions.

For a game that's obviously focused on reaction time and precision, the controls feel a bit sloppy to me. Playing with a keyboard and mouse is a bit frustrating, but the controller is worse. Stick to keyboard and mouse.

[h1]PROS AND CONS[/h1]
Pros:
+ An interesting setting, but one that's not examined in enough depth
+ It's very hard and unforgiving; some people like that
+ Achievements and trading cards

Cons:
- It's very hard and unforgiving; some people don't like that
- Unpleasant music, with no separate sound/music volume settings
- Controls could be a bit tighter
- No advancement or improvement, just the same thing each time
- Its name is in caps

[h1]CONCLUSION[/h1]
I'm a fan of most things 'cyberpunk' and I love science fiction twin-stick shooters, so I'd had UBERMOSH on my wishlist for a long time. The store page didn't suggest it was anything but a one-hit wonder, so I wasn't disappointed in the lack of depth in the game, but I had been hoping to enjoy the core gameplay more than I did. As far as the 'cyberpunk twin-stick shooter' genre is concerned, UBERMOSH is the game that I've had the least fun playing.

That said, it is what it is and it doesn't try to pretend to be anything else. You can regularly pick it up for just under 50 cents, sometimes including the soundtrack (not that that's a good thing, from my point of view), so it's also the cheapest game that I've played in the genre.

Given the discounted price and subject matter, it's hard to not recommend UBERMOSH in spite of its shortcomings. But be aware: it's difficult, repetitive, more frustrating than it could be, and there's really not much to it. 

[h1]5/10[/h1]

28923846.review:
90 seconds, enemy moving in from all sides, and you with a blade to cut bullets in half and perhaps a gun (if the class you select allows it). Sounds easy, right? 

Ubermosh is one of those games I play periodically because it can be a great deal of fun, and it is also one of those games I find myself enraged by, You are spawned into an area with a specific amount of 'respawns' or hits you can take, and you have specific abilities depending on the class you select. This means you can start with a sword only, an automatic gun only,  and mictures in-between. Your health is also adjusted depending on what you select, and this makes it a lot more difficult. 

I picked up the set on the winter sale for a really cheap price, and that makes it worthwhile. The second and third one are fun, and the third removes a lot of the landscape in the game and literally hits you with enemies only. There is also a version that has you on a bike, shooting stuff (i cannot recall the name of it, but I'm not a huge fan). It is fun, and amazing how much time you end up burning in 1 1/2 bursts.

28866633.review:
UBERMOSH ist ein extrem schneller "Shooter" - mit ein paar interessanten Ideen. Es spielt in einem Cyberpunk Universum und ist im Arcadestil gehalten.

[h1]Grafik[/h1]
Die Grafik ist, wie bei einem Arcade-Titel zu erwarten ist, sehr verpixelt. Das passt bei UBERMOSH besonders gut, da man sich so auf das Wesentliche konzentrieren kann. Desweiteren wirkt so das Blut der Gegner deutlich mehr als ein Teil des Hintergrunds, den man ausblenden kann.
[b]9/10[/b]

[h1]Sounddesign[/h1]
Die Musik ist ebenfalls passend, wenn auch etwas monoton auf Dauer. Die Kampfsounds sind - wie die Hintergrundmusik - sehr laut. Gut gelungen und ein toller Soundtrack.
[b]8/10[/b]

[h1]Story[/h1]
"The colony provides us everything. Except violence, that we still find in the deserts of Uldakaar".
UBERMOSH hat keine wirkliche Story. Im Tutorial wird lediglich auf die Kolonie hingewiesen, welche alles bieten kann, abgesehen von Gewalt - an der es in diesem Spiel keinen Mangel gibt. Da eine Story hier nicht notwendig ist, werde ich keine Bewertung vornehmen.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Man bewegt sich mit WASD und feuert mit der linken Maustaste, die rechte Maustaste dient dem wichtigsten Feature - das Zerschneiden der feindlichen Kugeln, welche reflektiert werden. Das Ziel ist einen neuen Highscore aufzustellen, eine Runde dauert maximal 60 Sekunden. Es gibt mehrere Klassen zur Auswahl, die alles von nur Schwert und keiner Waffe und nur Waffe und keinem Schwert bieten. Der weitere Modus "Hardboiled" ("Hartgekocht") hat einen separaten Highscore. Es gibt keine Integration mit dem Steam Leaderboard.
[b]10/10[/b]

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
UBERMOSH macht was es soll - und das macht es gut. Angesischts des niedrigen Preises kann ich dieses Spiel voll empfehlen. 
[b]9/10[/b]

Diese Rezension wurde von einem Kurator bei Canis Majoris verfasst.

28180606.review:
[h1]About UBERMOSH[/h1]
UBERMOSH is an arcade game about cutting bullets with a sword, in a gun-filled cyberpunk mosh pit.
A fast paced top down shooter and slasher, this game is, in a word, fun. Its addicting, easy to learn, hard to master, and just a great indie game. 
The gameplay is you start with a sword and ricochet projectiles at your enemies by reflecting. The reflected projectile kills your foes instantly, and you cut also rush an enemy and cut them instantly too. A dead enemy always drops a gun you can borrow. Each class you play has a varying amount of lives, and can be orientated towards a shooter or a slasher role. The Warlock starts off with the strongest gun in the game, and can reflect bullets, but also only has 2 lives. The no mod class/GREEN(The default class) starts with no gun, 4 lives, and can reflect bullets. Kansai starts off with 6 lives, and a sword, but can't grab guns. Gunner has 2 lives and a fully automactic gun, and can make any weapon, even the strongest weapon automactic. 
Only real problem with this game is a lack of content. Theres a Hardboiled mode, and 4 classes with alternate roles, some Steam achievements, and of course Trading Cards. However, the trading cards really have had their value dropped by a ridiuclous amount($0.24 to now $0.07). If this game had local multiplayer, that would be so amazing...*hint hint game developer*
To anyone who enjoys addicting fast paced gameplay, I highly recommend this game. Its speed, pumping electric soundtrack, fast paced action, low price, just mix together to make this one of the best games i've played in a long time.

All in All [u]UBERMOSH[/u] is a very nice Action Game! 

9/10 From Me
[i]Sweep[/i]

28142035.review:
UBERMOSH is a great arcade twin-stick bullet hell shooter with a cyberpunky retro aesthetic. I recommend this game to anyone who likes pick-up and play games with a good dose of challenge, personality and a classic feeling to them.

It's very basic; you get put into an area with endless enemies and you want to try to get as many kills as you can within 90 seconds or until you run out of lives. You can pick up any of the guns the enemies drop, and slice enemy shots with your sword to split them and send them back. It's simple, but fantastic and satisfying. The guns really feel like they pack a punch because of their sound effects and a minor screen shake whenever you shoot. 

You can somewhat change the experience by changing class mod, which can either take away your sword but give you rapid fire, or take away your ability to shoot so you have to rely on cutting enemy bullets as your only means of attacking. There isn't a whole lot of variety in the content, but if you like this content you can easily play it for hours on end, or keep it installed to play from time to time when you've got some minutes to kill. It's also got the right amount of challenge, since it has a learning curve and is unforgiving from the start, but once you get the hang of the gameplay and patterns it's doable and just a blast.

It's definitely worth the 2 bucks it goes for, and during a sale it will be a steal. Grab the pack, even, and get several great games for nearly no money.

26464892.review:
Crimsoland без динозавров, но с мечом.


Знаю, игра не нова, так что моё графоманство не будет не особо актуальным. Взял её только что потому, что уже долго мозолила глаза своим названием и даже не знал, что там внутри.

А внутри там:

 - ГГ и орды каких-то инопланетян
 - Несколько видов оружия
 - Меч, которым можно рубить врагов и отбивать снаряды обратно
 - Модификаторы классов, например, можно играть вообще без меча, но пушки будут лупить с огромной скоростью. И наоборот, если на голове у вас растёт сакура и вы чувствуете себя самураем, оружие с врагов вам поднимать запретят, только меч, зато ХП побольше.
 - Драйвовая музыка

Цель всего этого действа — продержаться 90 секунд, а по ходу дела нарубить врагов на ачивки. В общем, я под впечатлением и рад, что наконец её взял. А т.к. сейчас она вместе с саундом стоит всего 9р — советую брать. 

Не уверен, отдал бы я полную цену за это (скорее всего нет), но поверьте, в магазине сложно найти что-то сравнимое по интересности за такие смешные деньги.

26456420.review: Весьма прикольная игрушка, но на пару вечеров. После получения всех ачивок и карточек, скорее всего вы про неё забудете. 2 режима игры, типа норм и хард, 4 класса 1 персонажа. Не хватает таблицы лидеров, можно было бы посоревноваться. В общем по скидке однозначно брать, я приобрел данный проект так сказать на сдачу) UBERMOSH + Original Soundtrack = 9 рублей! Чуть не забыл) Очень и очень годное музыкальное сопровождение. Поймаете ритм и получите +10 к скилу)

26451740.review:
Купил игру по скидке за 9 рублей и отбил цену стоимостью карточек, так что первый плюс игры это "бесплатность".
Войдя в игру я ,почему-то ожидал чего-то интересного и получил бодрый и максимально простой в механике геймплей рогалик. Все, что вам требуется это стрелять и махать мечом (который к тому же отбивает пули врагов) на полупустой карте.
Даже такой криворукий игрок, как я смог получить ранг S+, когда понял лучшую тактику в игре: бежать вперед и стрелять на опережение. Враги тоже так делают, поэтому они мне и подсказали эту стратегию боя. стрелять назад нет никакого смысла, стоять на месте или разворачиваться равносильно смерти, а так вы всегда прорубаете перед собой врагов, как лианы в джунглях и спокойно проживаете необходимое время.
Не брать игру глупо, ведь она мгновенно окупит себя карточками в Стим.

26445290.review:
Adrenalina en vena. Tienes una katana para cortar balas y puedes recoger las armas enemigas, apañatelas. No hay mucho más que decir, el juego deja clara sus intenciones desde la pantalla de carga, el apartado artistico cumple su función de permitirte diferenciar sin problemas los enemigos del escenario,balas o de ti mismo, la música casa a la perfección con la premisa, la progresión esta centrada en la que hagas tu como jugador, la IA esta muy bien lograda y la satisfacción que me ha provocado verme rodeado por más de 10 enemigos, bloquear balas desde todas direcciones y salir sin recibir golpe solo se puede comparar a tu primer parry en la saga souls. 
Poco más que añadir, si es el tipo de juego que buscas lanzate a por él, cumple con las expectativas del género de forma notable.
Más análisis en mi canal de YT: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC82EL0OKeSEYTkCLi-ifjNg/videos

Me basto jugar 3 partidas para encantarme el juego y a la vez ver un error tan grande que si lo arreglan sera muy disfrutable, ALEJEN LA CAMARA POR EL AMOR DE DIOS, no se si es que el juego es tan simple que necesitaron acercar la camara hasta el punto de que cuando aparecen los enemigos no te da tiempo de reaccionar, bueno, uno si, pero de repente aparecen 10 en pantalla a la vez y es practicamente imposible esquivar, talvez eso es lo que querian los desarrolladores, no lo se, pero el unico objetivo es sobrevivir lo maximo posible en un mapa donde la dificultad esta basada en el numero de enemigos que literalmente te es imposible ver venir en un determinado momento, el problema es que nada te incita a seguir jugando, las partidas duran tan poquito y cuando pierdes no sientes que sea por que te falte habilidad, que si, pero no se siente, por la camara que te limita la vision.

YA NI SIQUIERA ES QUE EL JUEGO SEA FRUSTANTE, ES QUE DIRECTAMENTE CUANDO LO JUEGAS UNAS 10 VECES PARECE QUE YA LO JUGASTE TODO

Por ejempo, en velocibox es tambien un juego super rapido y las partidas duran nada, pero cuando pierdes te queda la sensacion de que sabes que no reaccionaste a tiempo, en este juego ni siquiera me queda claro si llegado un punto algo va a cambiar aparte de la cantidad de enemigos que es obvio, pero bueno, el juego por el precio se merece un recomendado, pero es tan simple su problema y tan facil de arreglar que no lo recomendare, pero si te sobra el dinero, y no te tiene que sobrar mucho, yo lo compre a 5 pesos mexicanos, que es menos de medio dolar, pues compralo y pruebalo por ti mismo.

26411332.review:
This game is everything people say it is. Action, bullets, and swords. The game sounds nice and feels really smooth to play however due to that smoothness I felt like there wasn't any real feedback wich will bring me to my next point.

Although the game is good, and is a must have if you like old school arcade games or bullet hell shooters, the thing that really turns me off is the feedback.

I like to really get into the games I play but here with the slippery movement, and seemingly random deaths I just can't do that. I really hope that this game will see some patches to address the feedback issue about getting hit. Plus the way it just suddenly shows you a game over screen just feels hacky. (Although maybe the intent is to make you rage, so you can get going.)

However I am still going to recommend this game because at this price it's a steal. (CDN$0.49 at the time of purchase.)

26400600.review:
[h1]是男人就坚持90秒[/h1]

这款游戏主打就是爽快，砍杀，格挡。坚持90秒已经不简单了，但对于每个汉子来说真正的爽快就是杀入敌阵，左右格挡，然后杀出一条血路。

26241313.review:
I can happily say that UBERMOSH is one of the most entertaining games I have played in a while. In this game, your objective is to survive in a mosh pit for 1 minute and 30 seconds, using your laser sword to reflect the enemies' bullets back into them, making up for a great defense mechanism, and to eventually pick up their guns and start your own carnage in the pit. 
The retro art style is lovely and really matches the game's theme while the soundtrack is amazingly energizing, fueling your space killing-sprees. There are several arenas in which you can fight ( randomly chosen by the game when you start a new run), but the only difference between them is the colour of the environment. Your arsenal is not really big but it is varied and has lots of uses: besides your sword, you can equip up to 5 (aproximate number) guns that are dropped by the endless incoming waves of enemies, each having different fire modes ranging from a shotgun to a single charged shot or a flurry of bullets widespread in a cone of fire. 
The game comes with 4 combat modes: the ordinary one, in which you have 3 lives and can use your sword and any gun you pick up; the "kensai" mode, in which you cannot pick up any firearms, relying only on your sword and starting the run with 6 lives; the "gunner" mode, in which you have no sword but any gun you pick up fires in a full-auto mode; or "warlock", in which you start with the best gun in the game and can use your sword, but you get only 2 lives. 
If you're looking forward to a greater challenge than what the base game has to offer, hardboiled mode is here to satisfy your needs, representing a much difficult twist on the base game that resets your overall score when you switch to it.
You can also get trading cards and easy-to-obtain achievements when playing the game, which adds to the value and makes the price worth it. In my opinion, UBERMOSH will not let you down if you're looking for a good time-killer or just for some good old top down shooting action, and I would strongly suggest buying it.

TL;DR: With a difficulty level that reminisces good old arcade games, UBERMOSH brings some new elements to the retro top down shooter template, and it will get you a decent 2 or 3 hours of fun for a really good price.

Ubermosh is a fantastic indie game with a cyberpunk atmosfere that I've never seen in another game before. 25898609.review: I absolutley love playing this game between queueing for matches, its killer music, fast paced gameplay, and scoring system make it great for quick breaks, and help warm my reflexs up with the bullet deflection technique.

25894338.review:
UBERMOSH, an extremely simple, yet balls to the wall hard game with an amazing rocking soundtrack & a top-down view of the action. Story is simple & quick to the point, cyberpunk utopian future colony where violence, crime & poverty is a non-issue but violence is a “basic need”, so what better way to blow off much needed stress than dropping you in a hostile environment. That is basically it, you are armed with a sword, which you can use to deflect enemy bullets back at them or slice them. Guns are dropped by enemies, simply running over them picks them up. The guns are nothing special, each have their own bullet spread and there is a total of 5 different guns. The game has a simple premise, basically your difficult to survive horde/score attack type of game. You are given 90 seconds & 4 lives on the basic mode of play. There are 4 modes or class mods as the game call them: Kensai, limits you to only use your sword, Gunner only guns & Warlock, which gives you the “best” gun as well as the being able to use your sword. Your amount of lives varies between each mod. Gunplay is average serving more to thin the numbers rather than being your main method of attack, the sword being your main weapon & “shield”, with its ability to deflect bullets, against the onslaught. Despite the enemy bullets coming in hard & fast, they are brightly neon colored so you have a decent chance of being able to evade/deflect them.

Ubermosh can be played with both a mouse/kb & controller. It does not feature a graphical setting menus or any other menu for that matter. The game is extremely short considering it doesn’t really have story to tell & consists of nothing more than fighting the horde of enemies for 90 seconds or your death. There was a minor flaw involving the walls, in which having you move next to them it just stops your movement & gets you stuck to them which is an annoyance in such a fast paced game. No leaderboards as well, so you will have to resort to sharing score the old fashioned way.  All in all, despite that minor flaw, it is a decent time waster with a pretty cool soundtrack that will have you head banging along to the beat as you slice & dice your way through the horde.

25735904.review:
tldr; great game, easily worth the full price.  Some wonkyness in terms of bullet spawn and hitboxes, but it's consistent and predictable with some practice, and fun from the start.


[b][u]My take[/u][/b]
If you consider yourself a twitch gamer, this gem will test your mettle.  If you consider yourself patient, this game will cause you to re-evaluate.  If you like a challenge, the achievements associated are a feather for your cap (especially Kensai CM).

This game has stones - big ones.  And rage.  And an awesome soundtrack.

Games last 90 seconds or less - if you're a winner it'll end at 90 seconds no matter what.  Short, simple, video arcade runs are the only thing this game is; variations include random spawn, 4 class mods (CMs), 5 types of gun (sounds low but it's more than enough), and a couple of different maps (always random).

There is some predictability to enemy movement but they'll surprise you, too.  A small visible area  is a *feature* of the game designed to make it twitchy, but to compensate, bullets move slow enough that you can [i]almost[/i] outrun them... but not quite.  In other words, it's balanced.

VERY nice work, devs!

[u]Pros:[/u]
~Controls are both simple and intuitive
~Game action is smooth and uniterrupted
~Excellent soundtrack, appropriate to game action
~Game has NEVER crashed or glitched in ~13 hours play

[u]Cons:[/u]
~Some will find hitboxes glitchy, but it can be learned and compensated for
~Some will not like bullet spawn being in front of the gun, rather than enemy giving indication of firing
~Some will not like minor screen shake upon being hit by enemy fire
~Player cannot slide along walls, meaning, you can't move diagonally in the direction of a wall that you're already touching; you have to clear the wall first

***A note as to the "Cons" - having a dozen hours of playtime invested, I have found these things to be [i]features,[/i] rather than negatives, because they are predictable and one can adjust play to compensate.

25720139.review:
(Special thanks to Spookymcslave to providing this game.  Thanks, man.  :) )

[h1]You walk into the arena to hear the crowd cheering before you witness an army before you.  Were they cheering for a mountain of bodies or your head on a pike?[/h1]

[i]UBERMOSH[/i] is an arcade-style arena game with minimal story and plug-and-play action with 4 playstyles to choose from and challenging achievements.  Overall, it was pretty fun.

As stated before, [i]UBERMOSH[/i] is by no means easy, but it is possible to complete within 90 minutes (about as long as it took me while watching the first presidential debate of 2016).  Scoring high while overwhelmed in an arena that's almost danmaku-like can be quite a challenge, especially while more and more troops spawn in, firing their weapons at you (Hope you've been practicing your [i]Touhou[/i]).  The gameplay is said to randomly generate arenas too, though I'm not sure if they're truly random or if there's simply a library of arenas in which one pre-made arena is chosen.  Either way, the randomized(?) arena gives this title more replayability.

The music to this game is awesome, the graphics look sweet, and the gameplay is solid, making this a positive experience even if the difficulty is ramped up.  The girl on the title screen also isn't bad to look at either. (in my opinion, at least)

Now, the game is ordinarily priced at $2, but when it goes on sale, it only costs $0.50, which feels to be a fair price.  I highly recommend grabbing this when it goes on sale.

8/10  A retro-style arena shooter that is worth your time.  How many lives will you claim before yours is claimed as well?

Ubermosh traz a temática cyberpunk a um gameplay rápido e intenso. O objetivo é matar a maior quantidade possível de inimigos durante 90 segundos. Para isso, a protagonista usa uma espada capaz de cortar e refletir os tiros dos alienígenas e também pode utilizar armas de plasma.

此游戏为街机玩法，2D像素风格射击游戏。左手刀，右手枪，战场上依然是你一人对战成吨的敌人，成吨的弹幕袭来；作为主角的你，一个竜神の剣を喰らえ，弹幕尽数被反弹回去，留下一地的枪和.......呃。

街机游戏遵循重复多周目玩法，但此游戏玩多了会觉得厌烦，因为，此游戏在猫某看来，仅仅就是一款用来练习技巧和走位以及反映速度的“Roguelike”模拟器，若是此游戏的7个成就都能独自完成的话，那么市面上的这些自瞄准星像素风格类型的Roguelike游戏，你也基本上掌握了其技巧了。推荐！

[spoiler]猫某用变速齿轮把游戏速度调到了2.5x，那酸爽简直不是一般的正宗，你们口以试试。[/spoiler]

25491101.review:
别看我点了推荐，不推荐，真心不推荐。点推荐，只是不想让别人觉得我是那种因为自己弱鸡苦手就借口说游戏不好的人罢了。

[h1]先说优点[/h1]
+BGM算是蛮燃的
+画风比较简单粗暴，对爱好者来说算是好的
+剑圣模式（Kensai）下弹反攻击很爽块，叮叮叮的声效，会让你欲罢不能

[h1]好了，下面是缺点，就一个字[/h1]

[strike]太TM[/strike][h1]难[/h1][strike]了！[/strike]

1、相比敌人数量、弹道速度和移动速度来说，操作视野真的好小。正当你（我）以为自己绕圈跑就能把四面八方的敌人都照顾到的时候，后背冷不防会突然冒出个敌人，然后你（我）就会吐一口老血想要重来。
2、一方面，敌我双方都是范围性伤害，敌人数量奇多；另一方面，经常会有莫名其妙的小兵不要命地摸你（我）一下或者自杀式撞你（我）背后，你（我）挡都挡不住，绕都绕不开，只能在悲伤无奈中打出GG。（好歹设定敌方互伤啊！枪零弹雨中还TM有自杀式恐怖袭击，你逗我呐！玩个球啊！）
3、剑圣模式下，弹反攻击的有效角度范围并不像想象中那么大。经常会出现这样的情况：躲在墙角里的你（我），以为开着按键精灵蹲坑就能过关，结果却被各种看起来已经反弹回去的子弹不断地打掉血。
4、Warlock模式真的很坑：两次开火的间隔设定不合理，实在太久了，而且还只有两格血。经常四面八方的敌人涌过来，你（我）不断地走位却来不及开枪扫清敌人，最后因为没法突围而死。

要全成就真的很难。

我TM居然和这个+1性质的游戏死磕了五六个小时，真的也是没谁了……删游戏了。

25316178.review:
Can't recommend this one. Repetitive, with little replay value.

Multiple character classes kept me coming back to it, but the core game just isn't there. It's fast, bright, and flashy, sure, but it really boils down to running from one end of the map to the other, slicing up the same few randomly spawning enemies.

Some of the mechanics are pretty cool, slicing enemy bullets to launch them back at the enemy is pretty satisfying the first few times you do it, but it's not something to hold an entire game up.

The shooting's a headache. Firing shakes the screen so much that it more often than not disoriented me to the point of losing track of my character and running face-first into my death. I stuck mainly to the sword after that.

Enemies spawn around the map at random. There's no set pattern or waves. Any high-scoring round I played felt to me more like a stroke of luck than an accomplishment.

I paid fifty cents for this game, and I'm still considering a refund.

25226882.review:
Итак, поговорим об игре Ubermosh. Простенького вида платформер с кучей врагов. Цель - выживать как можно дольше. Правда, я не понял, при чем тут киберпанк. Скорее альтернативная вселенная. 
Выжить здесь трудно. Вас будут окружать и плаить в спину люди и гуманоиды, похожие на Веномансера из Доты 2. 
Вы думаете, что у вас отличная реакция  - ошибаетесь. Просто начните играть в эту игру, и в этом убедитесь. 
Здесь есть несколько видов оружия, причём они различаются по цвету пуль и по типа стрельбы. Начиная с тяжелых, больших патронов, заканчивая дробовиками. Далее естоит отметить, что здесь есть несколько режимов игры. 
И самое сладкое на последок. Мы можем отбивать пули! У нас(ну у вас) есть меч, который атакует с такой нифига себе скоростью, что позволяет нам мнгновенно выносить до 3 врагов одновременно (по крайней мере, у меня больше не получалось).
Итак, мы видим сложный survival плаформер с геймплеем типа ходи убивай, мы видмм малую цену, на которую и так делают скидки. Я приобрел эту игру за 20 рублей, остался доволен. Но вот в чем соль - она может быстро надоесть. 

Итог - рекомендую к покупке. Хотя бы просто для того, что худо-бедно развить реакцию. Кстати, не бойтесь отсутствия языка. Интерфейс понятный, кнопка PLAY самая большая, а дальше человек с детсадовским английским разберется.

25201870.review:
This game provides great entertainment in small bursts of 90 seconds with a resonable price of 2$.

Visually, the game is heavily inspired by cyberpunk themes. Colorful sprites, striking menu artwork and even the font all help bringing its Sci-fi asthetics home. Most of the tracks in the OST are heavily inspired by heavy metal, featuring distorted guitar riffs and crisp drum-and-bas that never fails to get your blood pumping hand your head banging.

Gameplay wise, Ubermosh takes place in the Ultakaar desert. You have one goal, and one goal only: SURVIVE. Right off the bat, the game's flaws began to rear its ugly head: enveloping the desert is the enemy spawnpoint, referred ingame as Extraction Zone. The player will be kicked to the menu after staying in this area for a certain amount of time. This creates a surprisingly small playground for the player to maneuver. In keeping with the small scale theme, the weapon roster is fairly humble. The most basic weapon in the game is the sword. This weapon is especially effective because all enemies in the game dies in one hit, either of their own bullets or strike of your sword, and bullets penetrate indefinitely. There are only 5 ranged weapons in Ubermosh. Most of them are fun to use in their own rights, with each having different bullet patterns. But once you get your hands on the best weapon in the game, you'll find yourself never using other weapons ever again. This is made difficult by the fact that, once you walk pass a gun dropped by an enemy, your character will automatically pick it up and use it. Avoiding unwanted weapons on the floor now becomes an active gameplay element as a result. Ubermosh is heavily dependent on reflexes. Enemies spawns are randon and usually outside of your viewing range. There are no visual indicators to suggest impending enemy fire, which makes dodging and reflecting bullets immensly challenging and heavily dependent on luck. Ubermosh provides players with the option of different modifications of your character. There is "Kensai" mode, where the only weapon the player could use is the sword. Being the opposite, "Gunner" mode completely remove the sword, leaving the player with the ability to shoot all guns automatically. "Warlock" mode gives the character the best weapon in the game and the sword, along with significantly reduced HP (reffered as "Respawns" in game). The game could also be switched to Hardboiled Mode, increasing the number of enemies in a level. Controls in Ubermosh are simple, snappy, responsive and perfectly serves the purpose of the game, a straightfoward arcade shooter. 

To wrap this review up, Ubermosh is an immensly entertaining game, especially for its price. Although it's flaws are quite glaring, the core gameplay is fun enough to make you forget about them. A great game to spend 90 seconds of your life on.

25175456.review:
This fast-paced game will really put your twitch reflexes to the test. Each run lasts about 90 seconds, but they'll be the most intense 90 seconds ever. Enemies around every corner, forcing you to be fully aware of your surroundings. There is a wide array of guns to help you along the way, but once you get the best gun (The one that shoots red bullets), the fight really begins. You can also slice bullets with your sword, and fling the enemy's bullets back at them while slicing them in half. One word: badass.
--
There are a lot of challenges that will keep you coming back and playing this game again and again. In this game, you get 4 classes total: Green (No class mods), Kensai (Sword only), Gunner (Guns only), and Warlock (Best gun on spawn, sword, but 2 lives). Mastery of each class requires that you get 150 kills for the one you chose. This is more than enough to provide a challenge, so that you master each different playstyle under varying difficult conditions. You also get other challenges, like surviving 7 rounds without running out of respawns (Very difficult), and scoring 200+ kills 7 times (Gets easier the more you do it, but still extremely fun and challenging). There is also a different game mode if you want to go more hardcore called "Hardboiled mode".
--
After playing this, I find myself more aware in other games I play, and performing a lot better in general. I got this game for $0.50, and that's a steal. I'd gladly pay the full $2 for this game. Gave me hours of fun, and improved my reflexes. I highly recommend it to any skilled gamer seeking a challenge. It's well worth your time, and can be a good stress reliever once you get good experience at it.

玩了一会儿，给个好评，+1游戏中可以闲时拿出来玩一玩的趣味小游戏

只需一元，即可立刻畅玩是男人就坚持90秒，还附带具有一定魔性的BGM

其实90秒不是真正的目的，游戏真正的目的是在90秒内或在死亡前获得最高的分数，也就是击杀更多的敌人

我为了挺过90秒，选择了躲墙角的战术，结果发现这样得不偿失，因为虽然能活到最后，但是击杀的敌人却大打折扣，所以这个游戏就应该勇往直前，杀出一条血路，不放过任何一个见到的敌人

左上角可以选择模式，然后就点PLAY爽快的突突突吧 (●'◡'●)
============================================
全成就撒花，努力玩了好一会儿呢~~~

先是在无枪模式下被虐了个体无完肤，终于在无枪模式下拿够150分解锁成就以后，才发现还有个7次200+的成就，每个模式都尝试了不少把，发现还是无刀模式最适合解锁200+这个成就，因为无刀模式是唯一一个可以一直按着鼠标连发的模式，让杀敌变得效率了很多

7次200+完成后还剩一个7次存活成就，我在普通模式下补齐了缺少的存活次数（2次），因为普通模式最综合，可以用枪可以用刀，而且还有较高的4点生命值，比较适合存活（生命值就是游戏左上角的倒三角）

游戏在捡到比较高级的武器后就不会再捡起低级武器了，所以可以放心的在一地枪堆中来回穿梭而不用担心手中的好枪换成差枪，因此最高级武器这个模式就变成最坑爹的了，仅有两点生命值而且还不能连发

最好的方法还是选择靠墙打，这样可以让自己少面对一个甚至两个方向的敌人，自己目前也就最高打到350+，应该会有很多大神超过400

Se trata de un juego de acción indie en el que tendremos que sobrevivir a hordas de enemigos. Para ello, contamos con nuestra espada y las armas que dejan los enemigos o que recibimos si elegimos una de las clases permitidas al inicio de la partida, y que nos dan ventajas a cambio de "puntos de vida".

La jugabilidad es rápida y directa, tenemos que esquivar los disparos enemigos o partirlos con la espada golpeando en el momento adecuado. La cobertura del escenario también será importante para sobrevivir los 90 segundos del asalto.

Pros:
Buena música, estética pixel de los tiempos de la Amiga500 de estilo ciberpunk.
Contras:
Escenarios siempre iguales, poca variedad de enemigos.

Resumen:
Si lo puedes comprar a menos de 1€ vale la pena para echar unas partidas, además, puedes completar la insignia con facilidad.

24954392.review:
[h1] The colony provide us everything, except for violence... that, we still find in the deserts of Ultakaar. For now, welcome to UBERMOSH.	[/h1]

UBERMOSH é um jogo arcade frenético onde você usa armas  lasers foderosas e, corta inimigos e relefete os tiros igual ao um mestre jedi com sua espada. 
O game possui 4 classes diferentes: Warlock, Kensai, Gunner e No Class. Sendo que cada uma possui suas características.
Cada classe possui um número X de spawn core, que é a "vida" que o jogo utiliza. Levando dano você perde um spawn core, porém o jogo continua, sem dar uma pausa ou algo tipo para você se recompor e voltar para a partida. A partida só acaba se você perder todas as vidas ou se o tempo acabar, que são 90 segundos. Se você não se cuidar, pode perder todas as suas vidas num piscar de olhos, sério.
Além disso, o jogo não possui pause e também existe uma área no mapa que se você cruzar a linha, você sai do campo de batalha e retorna ao menu do game.

Jogo frenético com uma trilha sonora demais, que vai fazer você querer bater seus próprios recordes.

UBERMOSH é 10/10

[b]UBERMOSH[/b] es un juego arcade casual en donde tenemos 90 segundos para sobrevivir ordas de enemigos sin evitar perder nuestras vidas. Es un juego relativamente corto, complicado, pero no imposible. Su mecánica es simple, usamos nuestra espada para atacar y cortar (regresar) las balas enemigas hasta que se acabe el tiempo, o hasta que nos maten dentro de una zona limitada.  Además cuenta con tres clases (Kensai, Gunner y Warlock) que nos hará un poquito más desafiante el juego sin contar el modo "Hardboiled" que es su modo difícil. Por último, creo que una de las cosas más destacables del juego es su soundtrack, puede parecer un poco repetitivo a veces pero es pegadizo y va muy bien con eso de rebanar oponentes. 

Es un juego ideal para echar una partida de vez en cuando. Y con el precio que tiene, es casi un robo de nuestra parte.

24528608.review:
Biggest concern is the camera bounds; the issue you face in any widescreen top-down shooter is that you can see much farther to the left and right than you can from the top and bottom. Ubermosh is pretty zoomed in, with that limitation plus how far towards the edge of the screen you can get when you're traveling to the top or bottom, you end up walking straight into enemies just as you first see them.

I like the quick decisions between firing or slicing, I like the music changes on respawn. I wish the attacks were less random, perhaps starting at a specific distance from the player and repeating constantly at that enemie's given fire rate while the player is inside it's radius. That and zoom out a bit and this mght be a pretty good game.
